data.title: Suvarnabhumi’s SAT-1 wins UNESCO special prize for its exterior
data.description: Suvarnabhumi Airport’s Satellite Terminal 1 (SAT-1) has been awarded a UNESCO special prize this year for its exterior by Prix Versailles, which honours exceptional accomplishments in global architecture and design, according to the Airports of Thailand (AOT) on Wednesday.

data.title: Giant monkeys join sunflowers at Lopburi’s new landmark
data.description: Wanon Ranch has combined the province’s two iconic natural wonders to create a unique and selfie-friendly destination in central Thailand

data.title: GreenYellow, Unilever Drive 1,500-Ton Carbon Reduction
data.description: GreenYellow (Thailand) Co.,Ltd., a leading provider of solar energy solutions, specialising in solar power production and energy efficiency enhancement, and Unilever, one of the world

data.title: Kindness Launches Sunscreens for Every Lifestyle Need
data.description: Kindness, a Thai beauty brand founded by two visionary entrepreneurs, has unveiled three new Freedom Sunscreen formulas to meet the rising demand for health-conscious, eco-friendly beauty solutions. Known for their Clean Beauty ethos, Kindness products are crafted using advanced innovation to create skincare that is safe, free from irritants, and suitable for sensitive skin, addressing a variety of skincare needs.

data.title: Bangkok’s air quality deteriorates to health-risk levels
data.description: With PM2.5 pollution levels reaching the orange zone, BMA has advised residents to wear PM2.5-proof masks and limit outdoor activities

data.title: Illustration fair returns to CentralWorld
data.description: The Bangkok Illustration Fair is back with works by Thai and foreign illustrators at CentralWorld Live, 8th floor of CentralWorld, Ratchadamri Road, from tomorrow to Sunday.

data.title: How a country’s economy was looted dry by politicans
data.description: DHAKA - The new governor of Bangladesh’s central bank, Ahsan Mansur, calculates that about US$17 billion was looted from the country’s financial system by politicians in the 15 years before the government of Sheikh Hasina collapsed in August.

data.title: Philippine ship 'deliberately rammed' Chinese vessel, says China
data.description: BEIJING — China Coast Guard said on Wednesday an official Philippine ship in waters around Scarborough Shoal "ignored" its repeated warnings, and "deliberately rammed" and "seriously threatened" the safety of one of its vessels.

data.description: Huge shortfall in global funding for transition to sustainability is a major challenge for developing nations like Thailand: Deputy governor

data.title: Food for thought: Tom yum kung gets the nod from UNESCO
data.description: UNESCO celebrates Thailand’s rich cultural heritage and encourages the world to appreciate the cultural stories behind traditional foods.

data.title: Headline inflation up 0.95%, below forecast
data.description: The headline consumer price index (CPI) rose 0.95% in November from a year earlier, after the previous month

data.description: In a delightful blend of street food culture and riverside glamour, the 21st edition of "Raan Dung Ross Ded" transforms Shangri-La Bangkok

data.title: S.Korea's Yoon faces impeachment over short-lived martial law declaration
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday called for the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol after he declared martial law only to reverse the move hours later, triggering the biggest political crisis in decades in Asia

data.title: Unesco lists Thai prawn soup Tom Yum Kung as humanity’s intangible cultural heritage
data.description: The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation early Wednesday morning listed Tom Yum Kung prawn soup as one of Thailand’s intangible cultural heritage.

data.title: Muay Thai Phenoms Johan Ghazali, Johan Estupinan booked for ONE 170 in Bangkok
data.description: Rising Muay Thai stars Johan Ghazali and Johan Estupinan are set to clash in an explosive flyweight bout at ONE 170 on January 24 at Impact Arena in Bangkok, Thailand.

data.title: Relaxation, family trips, and new destinations to shape travel next year
data.description: Digital travel platform Agoda has unveiled its 2025 Travel Trends survey, highlighting the key factors set to shape the travel landscape in Asia in the coming year.

data.title: Tom yum kung gains UNESCO Intangible Cultural Heritage Status
data.description: Thailand celebrates another culinary tradition as its famed tom yum kung is recognised by UNESCO as an intangible cultural heritage

data.title: Bangchak Supports Thailand National Junior Tennis Athlete
data.description: Gloyta Nathalang, Senior Executive Vice President of Bangchak Corporation Public Company Limited, welcomed 13-year-old “Lookkid” Phasin Sinchalong, a member of the Thailand National Junior Tennis team. Currently residing in France, Lookkid is training at the Mouratoglou Tennis Academy.

data.title: Thailand to harness Airbus’ expertise in becoming aviation hub
data.description: Transport Ministry to work with Europe’s Airbus to expand aviation infrastructure and raise safety standards

data.title: Attraction of the ASEAN Economic Sphere: Japanese companies transferring production from China to Southeast Asia
data.description: An increasing number of Japanese companies operating in China are transferring their production bases to countries in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). This comes as Chinese economic growth slows and concerns rise over the risks of doing business in China, where foreign residents have been arrested on vague grounds.

data.description: An increasing number of Japanese companies operating in China are transferring their production bases to countries in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). This comes as Chinese economic growth slows and concerns rise over the risks of doing business in China, where foreign residents have been arrested on vague grounds.

data.title: Central Department Store reinvents flagship Bangkok location
data.description: Central completes comprehensive 4-billion-baht renovation of its Chidlom branch

data.title: South Korea lifts martial law after lawmakers reject president’s decree
data.description: The president of South Korea early Wednesday lifted the martial law he imposed on the country hours earlier, bending to political pressure after a tense night in which troops surrounded parliament and lawmakers voted to reject military rule.

data.title: South Korea’s Yoon lifts martial law after political gamble
data.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said he will rescind his martial law decree, giving in to the parliament’s opposition just hours after his dramatic move imposing it that shook markets and surprised other world leaders.
